name: unsympathetically
content:
unsympathetically adverb
(UNKINDLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows you do not understand or care about someone who is suffering: "But I've nowhere to go." "Tough!" he replied, unsympathetically. "You must be very nervous," Ferris said, not unsympathetically.
More examplesFewer examplesWhen I complained, I was unsympathetically told to use a friend's computer.The barman looks at me strangely, although not unsympathetically.Auguste shook him unsympathetically: "Get up, get up," he shouted.

unsympathetically adverb
(NOT APPROVINGLY)
in a way that shows that you do not like or approve of someone or something: I can't condone the way this woman was treated, no matter how unsympathetically you paint her. His latest novel was unsympathetically received by the critics.
More examplesFewer examplesThe novel fails because the main character is so unsympathetically drawn.The two men in the female protagonist's life are unsympathetically portrayed.
